magutils 0.0.0.9000

    • Vignette magutils

    Transform sqlite_master table to a dataframe.

    sqlite_master_to_df.Rd

    Transform sqlite_master table to a dataframe.

    sqlite_master_to_df(conn, temp = FALSE)

    Arguments

    conn

    An object of class SQLiteConnection to a sqlite database.

    temp

    Should sqlite_temp_master be queried, instead of sqlite_master? Default is FALSE. This can be useful when looking for temporary tables and indexes on them.

    Value

    A dataframe with type, name, tbl_name and sql statement from sqlite_master.

    Examples

    conn <- connect_to_db(db_example("AcademicGraph.sqlite"))
#> The database connection is: 
#> src:  sqlite 3.38.5 [/tmp/RtmpMqSS6k/temp_libpath66e98fe8daaa/magutils/extdata/AcademicGraph.sqlite]
#> tbls: AuthorAffiliation, FieldsOfStudy, FirstNamesGender, author_coauthor,
#>   author_output, current_links, current_links_advisors, pq_advisors,
#>   pq_authors, pq_fields_mag, pq_unis
sqlite_master_to_df(conn)
#>     type                       name               tbl_name
#> 1  table              current_links          current_links
#> 2  index         idx_t_AuthorIdgoid          current_links
#> 3  index                 idx_t_goid          current_links
#> 4  table     current_links_advisors current_links_advisors
#> 5  index      idx_cla_AuthorIdrelid current_links_advisors
#> 6  index              idx_cla_relid current_links_advisors
#> 7  table                 pq_authors             pq_authors
#> 8  index             idx_pqaut_goid             pq_authors
#> 9  index              idx_pqaut_uni             pq_authors
#> 10 index            idx_pqaut_fname             pq_authors
#> 11 table                pq_advisors            pq_advisors
#> 12 index             idx_pqav_relid            pq_advisors
#> 13 index            idx_pqadv_fname            pq_advisors
#> 14 index            idx_pqadv_idpos            pq_advisors
#> 15 table                    pq_unis                pq_unis
#> 16 index                 idx_pqu_id                pq_unis
#> 17 table           FirstNamesGender       FirstNamesGender
#> 18 index          idx_fng_FirstName       FirstNamesGender
#> 19 table              pq_fields_mag          pq_fields_mag
#> 20 index                idx_pqfm_id          pq_fields_mag
#> 21 index               idx_pqfm_fos          pq_fields_mag
#> 22 table              FieldsOfStudy          FieldsOfStudy
#> 23 index     idx_fos_FieldOfStudyId          FieldsOfStudy
#> 24 table          AuthorAffiliation      AuthorAffiliation
#> 25 index     idx_aa_AuthorAffilYear      AuthorAffiliation
#> 26 index               idx_aa_Affil      AuthorAffiliation
#> 27 table              author_output          author_output
#> 28 index        idx_ao_AuthorIdYear          author_output
#> 29 table            author_coauthor        author_coauthor
#> 30 index idx_aco_AuthorIdCoAuthorId        author_coauthor
#>                                                                                                                                             sql
#> 1                   CREATE TABLE `current_links` (\n  `AuthorId` INTEGER,\n  `goid` INTEGER,\n  `link_score` REAL,\n  `iteration_id` INTEGER\n)
#> 2                                 CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_t_AuthorIdgoid ON\n                            current_links (AuthorId ASC, goid ASC)
#> 3                                                                                    CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_t_goid ON current_links (goid ASC)
#> 4  CREATE TABLE `current_links_advisors` (\n  `AuthorId` INTEGER,\n  `relationship_id` TEXT,\n  `link_score` REAL,\n  `iteration_id` INTEGER\n)
#> 5                                  CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_cla_AuthorIdrelid\n    ON current_links_advisors (AuthorId ASC, relationship_id ASC)
#> 6                                                             CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_cla_relid on current_links_advisors (relationship_id ASC)
#> 7                   CREATE TABLE `pq_authors` (\n  `goid` INTEGER,\n  `firstname` TEXT,\n  `degree_year` INTEGER,\n  `university_id` INTEGER\n)
#> 8                                                                                   CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_pqaut_goid ON pq_authors (goid ASC)
#> 9                                                                                  CREATE INDEX idx_pqaut_uni ON pq_authors (university_id ASC)
#> 10                                                                                   CREATE INDEX idx_pqaut_fname ON pq_authors (firstname ASC)
#> 11 CREATE TABLE `pq_advisors` (\n  `goid` INTEGER,\n  `position` INTEGER,\n  `lastname` TEXT,\n  `relationship_id` TEXT,\n  `firstname` TEXT\n)
#> 12                                                                      CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_pqav_relid ON pq_advisors (relationship_id ASC)
#> 13                                                                                  CREATE INDEX idx_pqadv_fname ON pq_advisors (firstname ASC)
#> 14                                                                                       CREATE INDEX idx_pqadv_idpos ON pq_advisors (goid ASC)

#> 16                                                                                CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_pqu_id ON pq_unis (university_id ASC)
#> 17                              CREATE TABLE `FirstNamesGender` (\n  `FirstName` TEXT,\n  `PersonCount` INTEGER,\n  `ProbabilityFemale` REAL\n)
#> 18                                                                           CREATE INDEX idx_fng_FirstName ON FirstNamesGender (FirstName ASC)
#> 19                     CREATE TABLE `pq_fields_mag` (\n  `goid` INTEGER,\n  `position` INTEGER,\n  `mag_field0` INTEGER,\n  `fieldname` TEXT\n)
#> 20                                                                  CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_pqfm_id on pq_fields_mag (goid ASC, mag_field0 ASC)
#> 21                                                                                  CREATE INDEX idx_pqfm_fos on pq_fields_mag (mag_field0 ASC)
#> 22                                                      CREATE TABLE `FieldsOfStudy` (\n  `FieldOfStudyId` INTEGER,\n  `NormalizedName` TEXT\n)
#> 23                                            CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_fos_FieldOfStudyId\n                ON FieldsOfStudy (FieldOfStudyId ASC)

#> 26                                                                           CREATE INDEX idx_aa_Affil ON AuthorAffiliation (AffiliationId ASC)
#> 27      CREATE TABLE `author_output` (\n  `AuthorId` INTEGER,\n  `Year` INTEGER,\n  `PaperCount` INTEGER,\n  `TotalForwardCitations` INTEGER\n)
#> 28                                                           CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_ao_AuthorIdYear ON\n    author_output (AuthorId ASC, YEAR)
#> 29                                                           CREATE TABLE `author_coauthor` (\n  `AuthorId` INTEGER,\n  `CoAuthorId` INTEGER\n)
#> 30                                        CREATE UNIQUE INDEX idx_aco_AuthorIdCoAuthorId ON\n    author_coauthor (AuthorId ASC, CoAuthorId ASC)
